title: Alice Gentle
text:
Alice Gentle (June 30, 1885 – February 28, 1958) was an American <a href="opera">opera</a>tic <a href="mezzo-soprano">mezzo-soprano</a> and actress of three films.
Biography.
She was born on June 30, 1885 in <a href="Chatsworth%2C%20Illinois">Chatsworth, Illinois</a>.
She began her career in 1908 as a member of the opera chorus in <a href="Oscar%20Hammerstein%20I">Oscar Hammerstein I</a>'s <a href="Manhattan%20Opera%20Company">Manhattan Opera Company</a> (MOC). Impressed with Gentle's talents, Hammerstein began casting her in secondary roles in MOC productions in 1909, beginning with the role of Mercédès in <a href="Georges%20Bizet">Georges Bizet</a>'s "<a href="Carmen">Carmen</a>". She sang roles with the MOC and with Hammerstein's <a href="Philadelphia%20Opera%20Company">Philadelphia Opera Company</a> through 1910; including Emilia in "<a href="Otello">Otello</a>", the First maid in "<a href="Elektra%20%28opera%29">Elektra</a>", Flora in "<a href="La%20traviata">La traviata</a>", Lola in "<a href="Cavalleria%20rusticana">Cavalleria rusticana</a>", Maddalena in "<a href="Rigoletto">Rigoletto</a>", Nicklausse in "<a href="The%20Tales%20of%20Hoffmann">The Tales of Hoffmann</a>", and Siébel in "<a href="Faust%20%28opera%29">Faust</a>" among others.
In 1916 Gentle portrayed the role of Federico in <a href="Ambroise%20Thomas">Ambroise Thomas</a>'s "<a href="Mignon">Mignon</a>" at <a href="La%20Scala">La Scala</a> in Milan. She sang one season at the <a href="Metropolitan%20Opera">Metropolitan Opera</a>, making her debut with the company in 1918 as Preziosilla in "<a href="La%20forza%20del%20destino">La forza del destino</a>". Later that year she created the role of Frugola in the world premiere of <a href="Puccini">Puccini</a>'s "<a href="Il%20Tabarro">Il Tabarro</a>". Her only other role at the Met was Fatima in "<a href="Oberon%20%28Weber%29">Oberon</a>" in 1919. In 1923 she toured the United States as Carmen with the <a href="San%20Carlo%20Opera%20Company">San Carlo Opera Company</a>. She appeared in three films during the early 1930s: "<a href="The%20Song%20of%20the%20Flame">The Song of the Flame</a>" (1930), "<a href="Golden%20Dawn%20%28film%29">Golden Dawn</a>" (1930), and "<a href="Flying%20Down%20to%20Rio">Flying Down to Rio</a>" (1933). In 1940 she made her final stage appearance at the <a href="Los%20Angeles%20Civic%20Light%20Opera">Los Angeles Civic Light Opera</a> as Mrs. Cripps in "<a href="H.M.S.%20Pinafore">H.M.S. Pinafore</a>".
She died on February 28, 1958 in <a href="Oakland%2C%20California">Oakland, California</a>.
